video.title: CEO can code? Watch Netlify's CEO code a Sudoku app from scratch in a bar on a Saturday night
video.description:
Netlify CEO Matt Biilmann live codes a Sudoku app using Netlify while sitting in a bar on late one Saturday night. We recorded this in GitHub's bar in their office during the 2018 freeCodeCamp JAMstack Hackathon.

Matt co-founded Netlify in 2014. He's raised more than $44 million in venture capital funding. But he hasn't lost his coding chops.

Netlify is a San Francisco-based Platform-as-a-Service that builds, deploys, and hosts static websites and apps. You can learn more and create a free account to host your websites here: https://www.netlify.com

--

Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.org

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://www.freecodecamp.org/news

topLevelComment.text: for anyone wondering what the problem with the shared sudoku is: the problem is actually in displaying the sudoku values. he still displays the raw sudoku values and not the formatted values.

topLevelComment.text: im the only one who found that hes not using the formatted array for generating the sudoku? :)

topLevelComment.author: Travis Lannoye
topLevelComment.text: Not sure how you managed to get the app to suppress non-integer values at 37:38. I get all kinds of ReferenceErrors whenever I try to type anything, even a valid integer. The error message says "cannot access value before initialization".

replies.author: E-flat Major

replies.author: E-flat Major
replies.text: Vue because the upcoming Vue 3 API is going to make things much easier for library writers and maintainers, which will lead to an enrichment of the already rich ecosystem.
